Just Cause 2 Multiplayer is revolutionary. No other game offers the same level of insane chaos this game can muster.

I've played with friends experimenting with the grapple and laughed my head off. I've arranged Destruction Derby that were so successful the developers made a gamemode out of it. I've participated in some of the biggest, most insane mass racing, skydiving and faction wars I've ever witnessed in a game. I've performed solo and combination stunts with friends while co-ordinating over voice chat. I've went on a kill spee with my trusty sniper rifle and noscpoe killed hundred of enemies (other players at the airport).

It truely is an amazing game with almost no limitations: the biggest is probably your imagination.

reviewText:
Chaos is the name of the game. As of writing this up, Just Cause 2: Multiplayer Mod is still in BETA, but it is also released to the public. Get your key at: http://www.jc-mp.com/

Right now there is no story, no structure, no rhyme or reason, other than pure chaos. If you don't want to just run around mindlessly, hopping in vehicles, flying around, blowing stuff up, shooting random strangers, and seeing all hell break loose in front of your eyes, then stay away. For everyone else, come join the fun! As of now, I only see 1 server. But it is listed as X/3000 players. Yes, it would seem up to 3,000 people can be on this server at a time. I mean, how stupid would it be with just 64 players? Panau is big. I mean REAL BIG! Luckily, you can transport to different places at will with easy commands. /tp + the name of an area will instantly teleport you. For example: /tp airport2 will take you to a military airport, where you can steal some airplanes. That is if you don't get mowed down by other players first. There also other commands, like /fp which will actually allow you to play in a first person mode. And oddly, it works pretty well.

Sadly, the community for the beta is pure garbage. The chat box will be flooded with spam pretty much 99% of the time. So ignore it like a normal person would. Don't expect any questions to be answered within the game.

This mod of course piggybacks off of Just Cause 2, and the download is extremely small, racking in at under 20mb. Just make sure you have Just Cause 2 installed first.

As of now there are no real gameplay modes, other than the ability to join races. Everything else is just one gigantic and enormous free for all.

See you all in game!

This is just a small impression, and not an actual review. I will be doing a full review after the mod is officially out of beta.

reviewText:
Like the name implies, this is a mod for the game Just Cause 2 and not a game by itself. You will have to purchase the full game in order to use this mod. What other gamers have done with this mod is take the Just Cause 2 gaming experience to a whole new level of multiplayer fun.

Pros    Hundreds of other players in one game world. Thousand players possible!
Server commands like teleporting, first-person view, increasing vehicle speed, and much, much more.
Custom game modes like racing, crafting, destruction derby, and tron all possible in one server.
Custom shops that allow you to spawn vehicles, weapons, and server items for free or using the server currency.
Roleplay servers.
Almost lag free on the most populated server.
Server chat and admins.
Passive mode if you don't want to be killed (but you can't kill anyone else.)
Cons
If there is lag between you and the other players, it will affect combat and some vehicle interaction.
Combat between players is largely left to vehicles and snipers/rocket launchers.
Not nearly as active as it was during beta testing or at release.
The map is so big that finding anyone outside of the main airport and some key locations may not be common enough.
Donor only items and features on individual servers.
NPCs may have been removed.
ConclusionI played for a few hours during the beta and then just now. A lot has improved since the beta but player count has predictably gone down. Still, it's hard not to have fun with this mod if you are looking to mess around with other people on a huge sandbox. I only visited one server during my play today--the largest one--but I'm sure the other servers can offer unique experiences of their own. Much of my time was spent playing the minigames like racing, tron game, and destruction derby. I also spent some time flying around using the speed boost console command (or key) to make cars fly and crash planes into other players.

The multiplayer that the base game needed is here in a very well done way.

Alright, played an hour of the mod, here are my impressions:

Just Cause 2, the base game, is extremely fun and huge and beautiful, everything a sandbox game should be. The multiplayer mod is all those things as well - however...

There are no NPCs. That means no civilians to hassle or cops to hassle you. At first I was annoyed by this (what's the point of a sandbox destruction game if there is no one to stop you?) but I realized that in the bigger servers, other players function just as well as civilians and cops. The server I was in had over a thousand people, and the max capacity of the server was apparently 10,000 - but who knows if that's really possible. Anyway, some of those 1,000 people will be jerks and try to kill you for no reason, some will just want to blow ♥♥♥♥ up with you. Still, lack of NPCs might hurt long-term enjoyment of the game and will definitely make private/smaller servers feel like you're in a very empty world.

There are no missions/quests. You can still run around the country blowing ♥♥♥♥ up and working towards 100%ing the map, but the story mode has been completely extricated from the game. This, plus the previous point, means its strictly a sandbox game now. Make your own fun. That sorta thing. If you played minecraft for ten minutes, said 'what's the point?' and uninstalled, you probably won't like this and that's fine!

That being said - if you're the type of person who can make their own fun, you'll love this. Lots of racing ranging from the serious to wacky (I finished 17th in a 25-man limousine race). reviewText:
This is easily one of the most awesome online experiences available on Steam. This isn't due to the game being well-constructed for a multiplayer experience, as this game is a mod allowing a single player game to be played in groups. This isn't an MMO, this isn't a team-based game, and when playing the multiplayer mod I honestly feel there is no set of objectives to fulfill and no real purpose.

And this is EXACTLY where this mod shines.
You don't need to have a purpose to mess around driving like crazy with some friends, moving from vehicle to vehicle at 100 MPH, or falling from 4500 feet up and landing by using a hookshot instead of a parachute.  As an open world multiplayer experience, Just Cause 2 Multiplayer is wonderful for just how crazy dumb it can get, in all the best of ways.
This is especially true in instances that have such things as buying vehicles for free and the boost function.

To sum it up :
I flew a boat into the stratosphere. This is awesome.

Summon weapons and vehicles to add your own mischief to the mix, and choose from a variety of character models & skins to customize your appearance.
